bibl.title: Temple Economy in the Nag' el-Mesheikh Ostraca.
Acts of the Tenth International Congress of Demotic Studies. Leuven, 26-30 August 2008.

bibl.note: The Nag' el-Mesheikh ostraca (over 180 Demotic texts on limestone, now scattered among more than a dozen museums and libraries) record the economic activities of the local temple of the goddess Mḥyt (3rd century BC). - Introduction. - The site of Nag' el-Mesheikh. - Acquisition, location, and publication of the Nag' el-Mesheikh ostraca. - Contents of the Nag' el-Mesheikh ostraca. - Orders for payment in kind. - Receipts for payment in kind. - Orders for payments in money. - Accounts. - Conclusion.
bibl.seg: Brian Muhs, Temple Economy in the Nag' el-Mesheikh Ostraca.

Mark Depauw & Yanne Broux (edd.), Acts of the Tenth International Congress of Demotic Studies. Leuven, 26-30 August 2008 = Orientalia Lovaniensia Analecta. 231 (Leuven - Paris - Walpole, MA, 2014) pp. 155-164.

The Nag' el-Mesheikh ostraca (over 180 Demotic texts on limestone, now scattered among more than a dozen museums and libraries) record the economic activities of the local temple of the goddess Mḥyt (3rd century BC). - Introduction. - The site of Nag' el-Mesheikh. - Acquisition, location, and publication of the Nag' el-Mesheikh ostraca. - Contents of the Nag' el-Mesheikh ostraca. - Orders for payment in kind. - Receipts for payment in kind. - Orders for payments in money. - Accounts. - Conclusion.
